A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It's hard to imagine a worse story than this one. Disney was given one of the most iconic characters in cinematic history and completely (and I mean COMPLETELY) wasted him. You know the scene where Luke is handed his lightsaber and he chucks it over a cliff? That's a metaphor for what Disney (actually Kathleen Kennedy) has done. Star Wars is a dead franchise unless it walks back the decisions it has made...somehow.
